tweet: A Flock of Lapwing at dusk on the River Quoile. The gloaming is here. Darkness is threatening , but I know that light, will always win. Even if I’m not here to see it. Knowing I did my best, as we all must. To let the light in. Hanging on to that 🌟

tweet: He has tried to deter me because he knows how difficult it is, how heartbreaking caring for the natural world is. How it is so difficult to protect nature and how many obstacles there are. He also wakes up every day, heavy hearted or not and keeps on giving it everything. 💪

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: In my short life (so far!) I have received a lifetime of knowledge from my dad who has been an ecologist and conservationist for over twenty years. tweet:
Some birds sing when sun shines bright
Our praise is not for them
But the ones who sing in the dead of night
We raise our cups to them
Wherever he (Orpheus) is wandering
Alone upon the earth 
Let our singing follow him
And bring him comfort 

@hadestown -🙌💚🌱 Ballynoe Holloway https://t.co/wilzpAFDp1

description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @Hancock2001 So overwhelming, Charlie. There are stark truths though and our decision making needs to reflect how we want to live and how we connect all the dots. One step at a time so we don’t become stunned. We can do it 💚

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: #ExtinctionTheFacts is hopefully, the gut wrenching punch we need. Now let’s get to work. There is no way in this earth that I will tell future generations that I did nothing. Let’s promise to do all we possibly can. Work together. Make better decisions. Communicate the facts 🙌

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I would also say that the change we so desperately need will never be achieved by governments who promote an economic model of unsustainable growth. Right wing governments will always seek the gratification of the wealthy, not those in need, not nature. #ExtinctionTheFacts

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: Not until every decision we make takes nature, climate and animals into consideration - the world as we know it will cease to exist. We ARE nature. We are not separate. We destroy nature - we are destroying our own home, our own species. #ExtinctionTheFacts

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: Every day I read articles to educate myself as a young naturalist, writer & future scientist. Yet, seeing it glaring from the screen, my heart is heavy & my anger is profound but I will not avert my eyes. No one should. I hope everyone is watching. #davidattenborough #extinction

name: Dara McAnulty

tweet: Nature. As necessary as breath is to being. This was much needed today 🌱 https://t.co/PyI2Dns0gD

description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I’ve never felt smug in my life, never known a moment of pleasure before darkness edged in and shrouded it. This is the duality of loving nature and seeing/fearing its destruction. I never feel like I’m doing enough (don’t tell me that I am). I would love not to feel like that.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I also dislike the word ‘Environment’ it others our connection and relationship with other species. It’s the reason why the word NATURE doesn’t trip off our tongues with ease. I still feel that every day we need to be raising awareness, though.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: Today is #WorldEnvironmentDay To me it is every single day! Many people have bullied and criticised my form of ‘activism’ for the natural world. To me there is no wrong way to engage if you have a good heart and come from a place of wonder, deep love and respect. https://t.co/NxWBccX9dY

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I say this in response to those stating  b/s about all lives mattering and it made me so mad because surely if we recognise the pain we feel as white autistics, that Black autistics are feeling that x infinity because of the added racism, brutality and vulnerability.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I’d just like to say, as an autistic white teen, yes it’s tough out there but I can disappear if I want I can blend in with all other white faces I’m not a target. Black autistics don’t have that luxury. I can’t imagine their pain & fear. Our experiences aren’t the same Not close

name: Dara McAnulty

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @BirdgirlUK My school has zero funding, it caters for a very wide area and is as diverse as you could get in NI. I just feel like it’s the wrong direction, I’ve been invited to the consultation but can’t possibly attend if it’s not going to be  available to people like me.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @JamesBeaumont2 @BirdgirlUK James, with respect grammar schools are not the literal opposite. They’re selective. I’ve been to one and now I go to an all ability non selective comprehensive - there’s a massive difference.

name: Dara McAnulty

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @JamesBeaumont2 @CharleyMillerCM @BBCRadio4 I don’t think that it is a blessing to be honest. It’s me, of course but many days are excruciatingly difficult. The constant attacks on my sensory system, the intensity of feeling. The noise in my head. It’s overpowering sometimes. I’m glad I can write and follow my interests.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @GrenvilleNI @CharleyMillerCM @BBCRadio4 Yes of course - this is true re epilepsy, but yes there is never a moment when I’m not being autistic.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @Becky_UniWorcs @IgHawthorne @richardmills18 @JoPavlopoulou @autisticlyaaron @BBCRadio4 Hi Becky, as you can see - we’re actually pretty good at telling our own stories. I didn’t need a non autistic promoting me or speaking for me. This is precisely my point! Please listen to autistic people as part of your research - especially adults and empowered young people.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @CharleyMillerCM @BBCRadio4 It’s not the same, Charley. Epilepsy is a physical condition. Being autistic is a neurological condition that I’ve never not ‘had’. It’s every moment of every day, since the very beginning. Yes. It does define me because it’s wound into every single action and thought I have.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: Rage. When my mum was so ill with corona virus and my dad struggled to work and balance the needs of three autistic kids. Rage. WE. Played by every single rule. Most of us HAVE. I miss my grandparents. I miss my friends. But rules are rules, no matter who you are!! Rage.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @SaoirseFox @IrishTimesCultr I don’t know the details but when I tried to read the review of another debut author last month - it was subscriber only as is mine but there was another review by an author today, that I could read no problem? I’m just wondering why that is?

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @MayoCorncrake77 @IrishTimesCultr It’s about equality, F and it’s not really about me. It’s about us all.

tweet: @naturebygreen @morss_alex @GeorgeMonbiot We really do, Iain. This keeps me awake at night! I remember the first nature walk I took my fellow pupils on at school, it was the best day it was a massive turning point! They Snapchat me e/day with their 🎥 & 📷’s!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @morss_alex @GeorgeMonbiot This is very true, Alex. A mess. I’m white but not rich. I go to a state school. I know so many ‘young conservationists’ who go to independent/private schools.The gap between us at some events is huge. I don’t have a/thing fancy or privilege . Just words & hopefully they’ll help.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @rupert_higham @commaficionado As an autistic I do know this - it’s a long and challenging road and although every autistic person is very different, that is what worked for me. Logical associations and constant reassurance from my parents.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @Alayanabeth Well he takes up most of the room and we are trying to be as low key about everything as possible re the book stuff. I never talk about it to be honest - I vent on here instead 🥳

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @rupert_higham @commaficionado My parents also taught me, that failure isn’t’failure’ it’s learning. Mistakes are necessary to learning too. We have a book at home called ‘Mistakes that changed the world’. As a society we need to change how we see the process of learning.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @rupert_higham @commaficionado As a 16yo autistic - I found martial arts incredible. It’s incremental and structured. Very little room for ‘failure’ as every step is a learning one and it’s also really interesting too. Lots of autistic kids are very happy doing martial arts.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @dartwalker It’s hard on both of us, yes! I was trying to subtly say that I’m not privileged. That we live ordinary lives. That the reality is, that we have no connections or wealth or influence as a family.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @SaraBarratt_CS We have one laptop in our house of five - which is also interesting when now all three kids have to do home learning 🤣

description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet:
Oh Bluebell Spinney, how I needed you today! 
My daily walk is beginning to change, not in route but in springing life. Spirits lifted by Willow Warbler, sky dancing buzzards and solitary bees. 
My cup is full. 
Hoping you are all having the best day possible. 
💚 to all 🌱 https://t.co/sXbRT4dE71

Showing kids the metamorphosis of tadpoles is a rite of passage in my book!

tweet: @rach_wat2017 @gutterbookshop @thebookseller BTW, the test was done when I was 7. 7 when they told me that I wouldn’t be able to do something that really interested me. name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @rach_wat2017 @gutterbookshop @thebookseller ...my mental health was already in tatters due to isolation and lack of challenge at school. It was the absolute worst. I know not all teachers are like this, but I also know from other’s stories that my experience is not unusual. I also know lots of inspirational teachers 😊

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @rach_wat2017 @gutterbookshop @thebookseller That same teacher put me in the lowest reading group - despite my voracious appetite for reading - because I wouldn’t ‘get inference due to being autistic’. My literacy was tested at my parents insistence, it came back as 16+ on the week I changed schools because... 1/2

tweet:
Day 8 of #lockdown 

A real chill in the air so I sought the heat of summer and my favourite comfort read. 

My sister’s period of isolation is over & we are all still well. 

I’d love to know what you’re all reading right now? 

Sending small shoots of strength 🌱 https://t.co/OlxEpo7MMN

On this side of the grave.

We ARE nature.

tweet: @totozanzibar Agreed!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @hutton112329 That’s exactly why I go about my ‘activist’ life in the way that I do. I can’t outline it all here, it’s too much -  but activists fighting over who’s doing it right, is not the way to go.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I’d also like to add, that not everything needs to be out there in public-all the actions we can take for our planet can be everyday decisions,  actions, a conscience that is kind & compassionate. We can be activists all day every day & nature will know, that’s all that matters.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I have been an activist years before the climate strikes and have been a part of many protests. Alongside this, we have to make space for beauty, wonder...and art!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: To those people who are sending messages to my blog stating ‘How the f**k is writing nature posts on Twitter & writing a book going to help the climate crisis?’I respectfully direct to this quote from the amazing Rachel Carson. There’s more than one way to be an activist! https://t.co/Y0X0RGBScp

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane Yes. Absolutely. My publisher has trailed bookshops and there’s nothing like it at the moment. I’ll be announcing it soon  :)

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane Yes. It is mentioned but my book isn’t a manual as I’m terrible at giving advice! I do write about the experience though. I think the way I approached it, was that it wasn’t prescriptive. I look forward to it every week. It keeps me positive knowing I’m doing something practical.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane Yes. Very true. I think people are waking up. In the book I have written, I don’t hold back on my views of the biodiversity crisis as well as many moments of beautiful intense connection. Nature writing has to now intertwine these two threads. So that readers know the truth.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane Obviously, knowing is very important (I need to know!) but having engaged with a group of teens for well over a year now, they do actually want to know - we’ve created a space where asking is among friends and it’s a safe and kind environment.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane I feel we have to let kids experience nature on their own terms. In my own eco group at school I waited until they asked me, then they really wanted to know and maybe less likely to forget. Most know now all garden birds by their song and many wildflowers, insects and fungi.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @_alanbradbury @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane Alan I think we should reserve judgement & I don’t honestly think that’s an issue. I know lots of kids who love being out in nature but don’t necessarily know ‘facts’. Imho too much emphasis on naming and not enough on asking kids how they ‘feel’ when they’re out in nature.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @LucyMcRobert1 @emily_seccombe @Kaulofthewilduk @ArjunDutta228 @Appletonwild @AFONature @ukyouth4nature @RobGMacfarlane It’s the only subject I actually engage with on Twitter comments because I’m so passionate about it but I won’t just accept it because idealistically I’d love to do it. There are so many other issues we could be putting our collective energy into!

name: Dara McAnulty

tweet: The education system doesn’t teach us enough about biodiversity, environmental issues, eco systems & most importantly how they are all connected. tweet:

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @Rob_Stubbs1 @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas That is the bottom line. Absolutely. First we need to solve access issues...and hunger, poverty and inequality. It’s all connected. The fabric of society is not made to be a super hero cape for nature. Or something...like that!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @ArjunDutta228 @GrahamFAppleton @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas But those subjects are integrated into life skills and necessary qualifications which have been compulsory for decades. As I said  it needs a niche in every subject &the curriculum needs to change drastically at both primary/secondary levels. We have a biodiversity module in bio.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @ArjunDutta228 @GrahamFAppleton @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I have a comment above somewhere about the ‘how’. Saying the word compulsory to kids is an automatic turn off!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @GrahamFAppleton @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I would worry too, that it would ingrain the elitism already present in the nature community.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @b1_moore @SJAMcBride Well said, Harriet! Exactly this. A silent mission creep that impacts all of society, our actions and our views. Very few see through the fog - short term, knee jerk ‘solutions’, every time at the cost of the most vulnerable and nature.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @ArjunDutta228 @GrahamFAppleton @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I’m not sure what the magic remedy is, but varying the weekly subject helps. I go to a comprehensive school so every background involved - including parents/siblings. Supportive teachers are a must. My bio teacher couldn’t ID an oystercatcher and they feed on our pitch!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @GrahamFAppleton @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I would like to be convinced, Graham - I wonder if any young people were contacted to hear our views, after all we kind of know how our peers are feeling right now. In a school like mine, comprehensive, it would be too expensive and there wouldn’t be any funding!!!!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @WaterVole @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas Indeed Jo - when are they going to do these studies on adults?!!! Would love to have a wander with your grandkids!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @m_a_r_t_j_n @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I think it’s important to come at kids without judgement because we can smell it a mile off. Just treat nature education like everyday life &it seeps in. Every Tues teenagers are literally running for their coats to get outside & have a bit of ‘craic’, that’s how they see it.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @m_a_r_t_j_n @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas Definitely not their fault. When I started my nature group - we just had the ‘geeky’ kids, now we have over 100 kids involved - that’s 1/5 of our school - and they know all garden bird species because we Birdwatch but they now can also identify bird song, wildflowers & fungi!

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas I’m worried that it wouldn’t be seen as a viable option for many, if the interest wasn’t nurtured in the first place. Nature education needs a niche in every subject so that we can see it for what it is - intrinsically linked with everything we know and are.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @RobGMacfarlane @curlewcalls @CarolineLucas Obviously I would never turn down an opportunity to study natural history. However, the innate love a child has for nature needs to be nurtured life-long as much as possible. I teach the skills above to my nature group at school. We have family days too with parents & sibs :)

tweet: So much life amongst the seemingly bleak and grey low-tide. Brent Geese, home here for winter, foraging for eel grass. Little Plover and Sanderling, rock racing, blink and you’ll miss them! name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: I really hope my tweet doesn’t sound boastful but I’m so sick of this narrative that autistic people are ‘fixable’. I come from a W/c background...we couldn’t afford the treatments in this article even if we wanted them. Seems to me like a way to make money out of the vulnerable

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: Can I just say, that even if I was in a ‘worst case scenario’ regarding the autistic spectrum / my parents would completely accept me for who I am and treat me with care and respect no matter what the circumstances.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet:
Dear @GetWellShow I’m autistic, my brother is autistic, my sister is autistic. We all lead full & beautiful lives; if society was more accepting -our lives would be even better. 

BTW  I’m 15, have a book out next year & have just signed a contract for book 2. My brain is 🌟🌟🌟 https://t.co/rJcJuj0fPT

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @bexterc This was all possible due to the fact that we were slowly changing the minds of staff and pupils with facts, persistence and passion. I’d also like to add that our school is a regular‘comprehensive’ but it is a very special school, welcoming, liberal and warm to everyone.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @bexterc Instead of plastic water bottles we have a water cooler linked up to the water mains - no big plastic bottles. We do offer some drink alternatives - water in cans and flavoured juice in cans. No straws. No cutlery or take away containers - biodegradable alternatives.

name: Dara McAnulty
description: 18 yo autistic naturalist. Multi-award winning author of Diary of a Young Naturalist. Wild Child - Out Now  🌿
tweet: @bexterc Thank you! First we had a huge display in our canteen about the problems with plastic. It was right by where people queue and so couldn’t really look away. We spoke to staff when we had a list of alternatives and costing. We did our research and presented it. Then...they agreed!
